definition: to cut up (into pieces)/to slice/to carve/to dice/to shred
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Rib meat sheep will be washed, cut into 4 cm square block.
sentences.chinese: 將羊肋條肉洗淨，切成4釐米見方的塊。

sentences.english: He writes dialog ue by cut monologue in two.
sentences.chinese: 他把獨白切成兩截來寫對白。
將蘋果削皮並切成楔形。

sentences.english: Then the second-place man sliced a fly into quarters.
sentences.chinese: 緊接着排名第二的人將一隻蒼蠅切成了四半。

sentences.english: A wartermelon is cut into four equal pieces.
sentences.chinese: 一個西瓜被切成四等份。

sentences.english: Then cut the remaining stick in two, lengthwise.
sentences.chinese: 然後縱向把火柴切成兩長條。

sentences.english: Cut the cabbage into fine long shreds.
sentences.chinese: 將捲心菜切成又細又長的絲。

sentences.english: We all think eating fruit means just buying fruit, cutting it up and popping it into our mouths.
sentences.chinese: 一說喫水果，我們就想到買說過，切成塊，大快朵頤。

sentences.english: On the wood for the ebony battens I cut slots into it and then sliced off the battens.
sentences.chinese: 對於黑檀木條我在木料上切槽，然後切成木條。

sentences.english: After grilled. Use the fruit knife cut it into 4 small pieces.
sentences.chinese: 等東西烤好後，用尖刀把它切成四小塊。

sentences.english: So the Woodman seized his axe, and with one stroke cut the Serpent in cno.
sentences.chinese: 所以樵夫抓起他的一把斧頭，將蛇一劈切成兩段。

sentences.english: For safer grilled meats, keep portions small to cut down on grilling time.
sentences.chinese: 爲了安全燒烤，將肉切成小塊以縮短烤肉時間。

sentences.english: With a smaller knife, the long quarters of the fish are cut into sections.
sentences.chinese: 飯田先生用一把小點的刀，把這條魚切成塊。

sentences.english: Cut the duck meat, green and red capsicum into diamond shape, set aside.
sentences.chinese: 將鴨肉和青紅椒切成同樣大小的菱形塊備用。

sentences.english: Make stalks into match sticks about 3 inches in length.
sentences.chinese: 根莖去掉粗皮後切成3寸左右長段。

definition: chunks obtained by repeatedly cutting a vegetable diagonally and rotating the vegetable after each cut
to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
to slice/slice/thin section of a specimen (for microscopic examination)
(of a male) to come of age/an adult male
